title: High contrast, vertical axis / Didone
author: fabi

comments.content:
Date of title would help.  
If it's old enough it might not be digitized.  
I found a similar font, Latienne designed by Mark Jamra:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132424im_/http:/typophile.com/files/LatienneURWbold_5680.jpg)
  
 [http://www.identifont.com/show?45O](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132424/http:/www.identifont.com/show?45O "http://www.identifont.com/show?45O")  
 [http://www.identifont.com/show?63B](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132424/http:/www.identifont.com/show?63B "http://www.identifont.com/show?63B")  
 [http://www.identifont.com/show?6FO](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132424/http:/www.identifont.com/show?6FO "http://www.identifont.com/show?6FO")  
Don
Closest I have so far is [Lust](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132424/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/lust). I suspect some bespoke typeface for the magazine... What's its name?

Thanks for your help!  
The type sample appeared in MADE Quarterly (edition three, 2013), designed by Hunt & Co.

Thanks for the information. I can now say it's [Domaine Display](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317132424/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fklim.co.nz/retail-fonts/domaine-display) by KLIM Kris Sowersby.

Good find Ryuk. I will add it to my fox-tail terminals list.  
BTW your link is broken.  
Don
